author: Staff Reporter
text:
: Even as the Delhi government came down heavily on private schools on the issue of nursery admission, schools have adopted a cautious approach in reacting to the government’s decision.

While some schools said they will follow the government order, others said that it is an attack on their “autonomy”.

Various private associations of schools have also reacted against the government decision to scrap management quota, calling it a “contempt of court” as the matter is sub judice.

Reacting to the government decision, D.K. Bedi, principal of Apeejay Pitampura, said: “Our school has always followed government decisions and will abide by this decision.”

Alcohon International Schools principal Ashok Sehgal said: “Trying to bring any order at this stage is surprising, especially when admissions have already begun .”

the govt's move is a direct intervention in our autonomy, which is granted to schools by the Constitution

Ashok Sehgal,Principal of Alcohon

International Schools
title: Schools wait and watch
